Authors:
Lijuan Peng, Tao Sun, Youlian Yang, lei cai, Kevin D Hyde,
Zuoyi Liu
Title:
Colletotrichum species on grape in Guizhou and Yunnan
provinces, China
Keywords:
Colletotrichum, multigene phylogeny, new species,
Vitaceae, pathogenicity
Abstract:
Twenty-eight isolates representing three species of
Colletotrichum were isolated from leaf and fruit lesions of Vitaceae in
Guizhou and Yunnan Provinces in China. The isolates were characterized
through morphological studies and via phylogenetic analyses of actin,
β-tubulin (tub 2), calmodulin (CAL), glutamine synthetase (GS),
glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GDPH) and the rDNA internal
transcribed spacer (ITS) gene sequence data. The combined dataset showed
that 22 out of the 28 strains was a novel species being a common
pathogens of Vitis vinifera (grape) and occurring on other Vitaceae,
while C. fructicola (four strains) and C. gloeosporioides (two strains)
were uncommon. The new species is described as Colletotrichum vinifera
in this paper and is illustrated and compared with similar
Colletotrichum species. The new species is justified based on both
morphological characters and multigene sequence data. Pathogenicity
testing to perform Kochs postulate indicated that Colletotrichum
vinifera causes leaf spots and anthracnose of table grape but not
host-specific.
